body: Prevents  #1341

title: [Beta] Fix npe in instant uploads
body: Should fix #1341

title: #1338: Correctly use delayUntil property of SyncResult
body:
Sets a minimum time of three hours between automatic synchronizations. 

Should be enough to fix #1338.

title: Multiple files upload from Google Photos application not working
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to any folder in the ownCloud app
2. Click on Upload
3. Select "Content from other apps"
4. Select Google "Photos" app
5. Select multiple (e.g. 3) photos/files
6. Click "Done"

Actual outcome:
- Only one file is uploaded (instead of all 3)

Expected:
- All selected files get uploaded

title: Lots of login failed in log after update to material version
body:
Since the last update to the new material design version, my owncloud log is being flooded with 

`
Error   PHP Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/user-otp/user_otp/lib/otp.php:310) at /var/www/owncloud/lib/private/api.php#346 2015-12-14T13:46:02-03:00
Warning core    Login failed: 'salas'
Error   PHP session_regenerate_id(): Cannot regenerate session id - headers already sent at /var/www/owncloud/lib/private/user.php#241  2015-12-14T13:46:02-03:00
`
The app appears to be working , but this flood is making very difficult be able to use fail2ban to block bruteforce attempts because connection from the new android app is generating a 'login failed' message.

Nothing was changed on the server (otp in use for a long time with no problem) and this log started appearing right after update to the material design, so i think something changed on the client;

ii  owncloud                              8.1.4-12.1  
ii  php5                                     5.6.14+dfsg-0+deb8u1
ii  apache2                               2.4.10-10+deb8u3

title: [Share with users, groups] Should not be accent sensitive
body:
### Expected behaviour

As mentionned for the client (owncloud/client#4286) and for the server (https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/21212), sharing a file/folder with users/groups is accent sensitive, while I think it should not.

In fact, you have to enter the name with the accent, in order it is proposed in the users list. Investigating a bit further, I noticed that "í" is considered as a normal "i", while "é" is not considered as an "e".

If it can help, Android issue with alphabetical sorting of accentuated letters was solved here: owncloud/android#1110
### Steps to reproduce

Share a file with a user called "frédéric" :
1. Long press on a file, chose Share
2. Share with a user or a group
3. In the box, start entering the name of this user: "fred..."
4. The name frédéric should be proposed, but it's not.
### Environment data

Android version: 5.1
Device model: LG G4
Stock or customized system: LG customized
ownCloud app version: 1.9.0
ownCloud server version: 8.1.2 on Ubuntu 15.04 (MySQL)

title: Instant upload with 3rd Party  Camera App
body: Instant upload  with 3rd Party  Camera App does not work. Is there any way that i can use instant upload with 3rd party camera app .

title: View Photos Temporarily without Downloading them to System
body:
One personal annoyance is that the ownCloud app downloads every image that I open on my devices to the internal storage. Sometimes, I want to view an image just temporarily and NOT have it automatically downloaded and stored to /sdcard/owncloud/.../.

Perhaps downloading them into a cache would be more proper, then if the user clicks the menu button, offer to let them download the image and then it would be appropriate to save it to /sdcard/owncloud/.../.

Otherwise every image I view from a different folder (and I have many, many folders) from the ownCloud app triggers Google Play Services to shoot me a notification asking if I want to backup that folder to Google Photos.

title: Implement a Document Provider
body:
One sorely lacking feature (unless it's already implemented in which case this is a bug report) is the lack of ownCloud's app acting as a document provider. A document provider essentially tells the Android operating system that it is an application that manages files. Google Drive is a document provider, and therefore whenever the OS-level file picker comes up (for example, when selecting a new image as a wallpaper), Google Drive is offered as one such service you can use to browse files.

Implementing this feature shouldn't be too terrible hard, all the documentation on it is provided here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider.html

title: Allow downloading of files (especially pictures) unzipped from share link
body:
Zipped downloads are not common for mobile useres. Users do not know (and do not want) to handle zipped files on their phone.

I would be happy, if files could be downloaded as single file.

title: Allow to share pictures with gallery link in addition to files link
body:
The owncloud gallery allows to generate gallery share links. I would like to use these gallery share links with my owncloud android client. They are extremly useful.

I may share fotos and videos as files, but people that I shared my photos do not know how to switch to gallery view. I would like to decide what kind of share link is generated at share options.

title: Android 6: new permission system
body:
I have installed owncloud on a fresh android 6 system.
After installing I could not download any file because the "storage" permission was not granted.
This should, according to the new permission system, catched during runtime and the user should be asked if one wants to grant this permission.

title: Add select all file when upload file to remote
"Unfortunately, Owncloud has stopped" after photo when AutoUpload is enabled
body:
After a photo is taken, I get the above behavior and the photo never gets transferred to the server.  This occurs over cellular, as well as wifi.  It even happens when wifi-only is enabled and the phone is not connected to wifi.  This is only occurring on our 50 or so Verizon Kyocera Brigadier phones.   Our other phones (mostly Motorolas) work fine.  If there is anything I can do to help solve this, please let me know.

domneu

title: Update Changelog for 1.9 version
Beta install fails
body:
Hi,

I just tried to install the 20151202 beta on a Nexus 5 Android 6.0.1 via f-droid. 
The phone was cleanly installed today.

It fails at the end of the installation process with the not so helpful message "Failed to install due to an unknown error"

Other apps installed just fine via F-droid.
Please let me know if there's a way to get a more helpful message from this.

title: ownCloud 1.9.0 constantly syncing
body:
Since 1.9.0 the Android OC client is constantly syncing and keeping the device awake when the auto-sync option under "Accounts" is checked. I've got it installed on two 5.1.1 devices and this behaviour occurs on both. Once it has finished scanning the whole folder structure it starts again after 30-60 seconds, keeping the device awake (it never goes do deep-sleep), draining the battery and generating permanent traffic.
This didn't occur with 1.8.0. Because of that I had to disable auto sync. 
Does anyone have this problem as well?

title: Chromecast support?
body: When viewing images using the built-in photo viewer, would it be possible to have a chromecast cast-button?  I don't know if it is possible to support chromecast without non-free libraries though -- if it isn't, I wouldn't want this implemented.

title: Unknown error ocurred!
body:
Hi,

The android client for owncloud is throwing the following error when trying to connect over HTTPS:

"Unknown error ocurred!" after testing the connection.

I just updated recently to core version 8.2.1 and suddenly the mobile connectivity stopped working. 

I am using nginx + php5-fpm (5.6.16-2+deb.sury.org~trusty+1 (fpm-fcgi)) in ubuntu 14.04 and the nginx config is directly the config you provide in the official documentation.

I put here a capture of nginx logs when the mobile app tries to connect:

 [08/Dec/2015:19:12:54 +0000] "GET /status.php HTTP/1.1" 200 106 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/1.9.0" "-"

It seems like the webserver responds properly but the mobile app fails to connect.

I am trying to connecto from a Nexus 5 with Android 6.0, but this is also reproducible in other mobile phones and in Android 5.x

This is getting very annoying and I would be very please if you could take a look.

Thanks in advance.

title: Delete upoad/download failed notification on successful retry
body:
If an instant upload fails on the first try a notification is shown. It seems that the app automatically tries to upload the file again (the pictures are all on my server even if the "Upload failed - The operation couldn't be completed, server is unav…" notification is shown.

Once the upload succeeded the "upload failed" notification should be deleted to not confuse the user.

title: Sorting by recently modified should mix files and folders
body:
Currently when sorting by recently modified first shows folders and then files. Rather we should mix them, whichever item was modified most recently. This is the same we do in the web interface.

Because right now the sorting is very strange for folders with a lot of items and folders – you need to scroll down a lot to get to the relevant items.

title: Limit download notifications
body: When downloading a whole directory, the download task is not handled as a single job. All files are notified separately and trigger a notification icon in the header bar on Android. Therefore one or two icons appear and hide again and again and you get no real notification about the remaining time of the whole download job, because the displayed time is only related to the currently downloaded file.

I tried to uninstall ownCloud and removed the SDcard folder ownCloud to check to simulate a fresh install. The error remains the same, the newly and empty folder is not moved to the new location.

After trying to reinstall the official app again from store ownCloud installation is refused with error code -505 (stating "ownCloud" can not be installed. Please try again - Trying again leads to the same behavior).

Addl info: The device is rootet and the SDfix applied.

After removing the beta, the offical app from store can be installed again.

Can I supply further info?

title: Storage path: switch to external folder after reinstall
body:
Hi @przybylski,

on a fresh install I have switched the storage path to external sdcard and used it a lot.
After a reinstall (due to some tests) I wanted to switch a fresh-install back to the external sdcard.
This does not work as owncloud says that the folder is existing (we talked about it).

Now the question is, how to deal with such a situation? Deleting the folder and download all files once again is not a good option.
The official app does not care if the folder exists and tries to use it, or?
Maybe, if the folder exists the app should ask: "use it" or "rename and move internal folder to external".

What do you think?

title: update version number in conf.py
update for 1.9 release w expanded sharing
owncloud 1.9 does not install while beta is installed and vice versa
body: I get repeatedly the error 505 while

title: User manual updates did not get published
body: Hey all, re https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1254 -- the changes did not get published to https://doc.owncloud.org/android/. I took a look at the Jenkins config, and do not understand it. Please I need someone to fix this so that the manual gets published correctly.

title: Clearing application data removes passcode
body:
If the application data is cleared via app info (Settings > Apps > ownCloud > Storage > CLEAR DATA), then the PIN is removed, too. But as the account info is kept, starting the app again will give one access to the account without any PIN code.

Tested on Nexus 5 with Android 6.0 and ownCloud Android App 1.8.0.

title: Android - Duplicate files.
body:
When I upload a file from my phone to my server, the app creates a folder on my phone and copies the file to that folder... so now I have 2 copies of ever file I upload on my phone. This effectively cuts my phone storage in half, and is crazy if I want to upload hundreds or thousands of photos. What is the thinking behind this? Dropbox does not do this.

If this "feature" is going to remain then it should be able to be turned off in the settings. Yes, I could upload a file then go and delete the copy that was made on my phone, but I don't want to do this.

title: Support for Nexus Imprint
body:
Google introduced a new fingerprint authentification service with the release of the Nexus 5X and 6P called Nexus Imprint. Github user @afollestad created a library that wraps around the Google Api and provides fingerprint unlock with a passphrase fallback.
Would it be possible to implement this as another method to unlock the app (instead of a PIN code)?

Library: https://github.com/afollestad/digitus

title: Sharing screen shows "Choose upload folder" instead of ownCloud
body: I'm on a Nexus 9 running Android 5.0.1, beta app 20151128. When I go to share a file from another app, the sharing screen presents me with an option to share to "Choose upload folder," with the ownCloud beta logo. This should clearly say ownCloud instead.

title: Crash upon start: NPE on FileDataStorageManager.prepareInsertShares
body:
Hello! I installed the beta client from fdroid an after entering login details I receive folowing message and have to close the app. Happens all the time. I can see the dirs for a short time every time I open the client but crash is following.

***********\* CAUSE OF ERROR ************

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.owncloud.android.datamodel.FileDataStorageManager.prepareInsertShares(FileDataStorageManager.java:1529)
    at com.owncloud.android.datamodel.FileDataStorageManager.saveSharesInFolder(FileDataStorageManager.java:1490)
    at com.owncloud.android.operations.RefreshFolderOperation.refreshSharesForFolder(RefreshFolderOperation.java:495)
    at com.owncloud.android.operations.RefreshFolderOperation.run(RefreshFolderOperation.java:216)
    at com.owncloud.android.lib.common.operations.RemoteOperation.run(RemoteOperation.java:303)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:841)

***********\* DEVICE INFORMATION ***********
Brand: Lenovo
Device: Kraft-A6000
Model: Lenovo A6000
Id: KTU84P
Product: Kraft-A6000

***********\* FIRMWARE ************
SDK: 19
Release: 4.4.4
Incremental: Kraft-A6000-m_S025_151016

title: Android 4.2.2 client: Server instance not found
body:
Hi, When connecting from Android 4.2.2, I get "Server instance not found". So, I used tcpdump to see the connection in server side. The results are: 18:33:20.717832 IP 192.168.0.200.58648 > 192.168.0.100.80: Flags [P.], seq 1:108, ack 1, win 229, options [nop,nop,TS val 7995951 ecr 397463523], length 107: HTTP: GET /status.php HTTP/1.1 E.../.@.@..C.......d...PA.-.;iz.....)>..... .z./....GET /status.php HTTP/1.1 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/1.8.0 Host: 192.168.0.100 18:33:20.717896 IP 192.168.0.100.80 > 192.168.0.200.58648: Flags [.], ack 108, win 227, options [nop,nop,TS val 397463528 ecr 7995951], length 0 E..4..@.@......d.....P..;iz.A..(.....L..... .....z./ 18:33:20.718500 IP 192.168.0.100.80 > 192.168.0.200.58648: Flags [P.], seq 1:449, ack 108, win 227, options [nop,nop,TS val 397463528 ecr 7995951], length 448: HTTP: HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found E.....@.@......d.....P..;iz.A..(........... .....z./HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Date: Sat, 28 Nov 2015 20:33:20 GMT Server: Apache/2.4.10 (Debian) Content-Length: 287 Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1 404 Not Found

Not Found

The requested URL /status.php was not found on this server.

Apache/2.4.10 (Debian) Server at 192.168.0.100 Port 80
On Debian, in /usr/share/owncloud, I can see the file status.php. My server do not use SSL and I am connecting via IPv4. Thanks, Eriberto

title: Beta 20151128 - is Cache size setting remembered?

The default cache size is 10 Mb. When I input a number, let's say 50, it gets set up to 50 MB. When I close and open Settings, it says 50 Mb. When I close the app and reopen it, it states 10 Mb.

It the change remembered? and that are the units? Mega bits or Mega Bytes?

title: [Duplications] [1168] Upload failed
body:
STEPS:
1.- Enable instant upload
2.- Behavior: select: do nothing
3.- Take an image
4.- The image is automatically uploaded

CURRENT BEHAVIOR:
Once the upload finishes, it´s shown a notification of failed upload
However, the file is uploaded

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR:
There is not any notification of failed upload

NOTE: 
This happens too if you select the option: delete
This has not been reproduced if the selected behavior is: copy

LOGS:

```
11-27 09:21:04.372  16868-16899/com.owncloud.android E/FileUploader﹕ Error uploading
    java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'char[] java.lang.String.toCharArray()' on a null object reference
            at java.io.File.fixSlashes(File.java:183)
            at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:130)
            at com.owncloud.android.datamodel.FileDataStorageManager.triggerMediaScan(FileDataStorageManager.java:1562)
            at com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader.saveUploadedFile(FileUploader.java:719)
            at com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader.uploadFile(FileUploader.java:575)
            at com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(FileUploader.java:521)
            at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
            at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148)
            at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)
```

Device: Tablet nexus Android 6

With the branch: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1168
Access to settings:
 It's included a new option under the Instant upload section: "Behavior: Do nothing"
- This is not pretty clear to me its aim (without having the background of github discussions :smiley:  @MTRichards @jancborchardt any suggestion here?

- On the other hand, when you tap on it, you may change the options
  ![settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1846927/11418229/6502c73c-941e-11e5-8a1c-d4929be364c9.png)

@tobiasKaminsky not sure about the difference between:
- move file to OC folder and delete origin file 
- do nothing - probably, we should define a default mode which I'd say: copy file to OC folder
  :question:

title: Beta: storage path setting too complicated / doesn’t need to be a file picker
body:
What exactly is the use-case of there being a full-blown file picker for this? We really just need a choice between saving on the local storage or on an external storage like SD card.

We should do that similarly to how [Maps.me](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mapswithme.maps.pro) solves it. Simple choice between the storage mediums. No need to choose the exact path.

cc @AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky @davivel 
(Awesome on tackling this though! Looking forward to be able to use my SD card so I have more space!)

title: Beta: storage path setting too present
body:
In the current beta, the storage path setting is shown as first entry in the settings. That’s way too present since it’s a one-time setting, if anything.

It should be in the same section as the Cache size. cc @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger @davivel

title: Share: unspecific error message
body:
Hi,

I wanted to use "share with users", but all I got was:
Sorry, your server version does not allow share with users within clients.
Please contact your administrator

Although I am the admin I was clueless ;)
After digging in the code the problem is that my server is 8.1.x and not 8.2.x.

So I suggest to change the error message to:
Sorry, your server version is 8.1.2 and sharing with users within clients is supported by at least 8.2.0. Please upgrade the server (or similar).

title: Instant upload doesn't check wifi on every upload file start
body:

But if the wifi connection where lost and some pictures have to be uploaded, the app uses the mobile connection to upload.

Looks like, that the app doesn't check the wifi connection on every picture or video on start upload.

body:
When selecting an empty folder when changing the storage path, the app crashes as it tries to access the list of files is set to the content of the folder and thus is empty:
LocalFileListAdapter -> swapDirectory
and then getView is trying to use the empty list.

Maybe a question if the app should proceed and write into it (and maybe overwrite something) is a useful idea?

What I expect to happen:
When I select "on device" I expect to see only the photos on device when I list through in fullscreen.

Hope I managed to explain myself :smile: I am not sure if current behaviour is intentional or not.

title: Update Library Reference: Add test for UpdateRemoteShareOperation
InstantUploud does not upload raw photos
body:
Since Android 5.0, Android has a new camera api with the ability to save the photos as *.dng. This is a raw format and very interesting for photographers. Apps like "Camera FV-5" support this feature.
### Expected behaviour

All Images/Photos will be uploaded into my owncloud, when a made a new one.
### Actual behaviour

The instantUpload is uploading the *.jpg and not the *.dng file. The files are in the same folder and the files are written in the same moment.
### Environment data

Android Version : 6.0
Device model : Google Nexus 5
Stock or customized system: Stock
ownCloud app version: 1.8.0
ownCloud server version: 8.2.0

title: Unable to log on from Android client
body:
I have an OwnDrive account to which I sync with the ownCloud client from various Linux systems. About one year I installed the client on an Android device to sync with this same account but I was unable to log in, always receiving the error message "Please enter valid details". I tried changing my OwnDrive password but the problem remained. Back then, various other users reported the same issue in  the Forum:
https://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=24&t=24242

Since then I have accessed my OwnDrive account with the Android device web browser. But now I would like to sync my calendar across all my devices. I installed the client again but it is still impossible to log on.
### Expected behaviour

The client should log on to the OwnDrive service since the credentials provided are correct.
### Actual behaviour

The client yields the message: "Please enter valid details" and does not log on. 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install the ownCloud client
2. Request log on to the OwnDrive account
### Environment data

Android version: 4.4.2

Device model: Samsung Note 10

Stock or customized system: customised (Samsung)

ownCloud app version: 1.0
#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)

How do I get this in Android? With a desktop Linux it is just a matter of using the -l option, but what about Android?

title: External storage added with "use session credentials" do not show in android app
body:
Before OC8.2, I had several external storages (SFTP) mounted on a per-OC-user base, so every user had to enter login and password to use the external storage. As I use LDAP, all user's logins are the same, so this was quite a bit of double work.

Now I switched to OC 8.2's new method to use session credentials. I globally added the external storage with this option, so OC logs in every user with his or her OC credentials to the SSH server.

This works fine in the web interface and with normal WebDAV-access.

The android app, however, does not even display the external storage mounted with "use session credentials".

title: Share with password and expiration time  getlink and more
Cannot unshare renamed file
body:
In Android client:
1. Share a link to a file
2. Rename file
Link still works
3. Unshare file
Error: cannot unshare file, make sure it exists
4. Rename file to original name
5. Unshare file 
Share is removed 

If the original name is unknown, file can never be unshared. Unknown if issue exists on Web interface.

UPDATE: Behaviour is inconsistent. Just unshared a renamed file a few minutes after test above and it worked. Now also able to unshare a file that was stuck for an hour. Retry of test procedure reproduces result.

title: Don't allow to remove passcode without entering it. Don't allow to set incomplete passcode
body: Fix for https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1251

title: Resized images: show small thumbnail while loading resized image
#1193 - optimizing the uploader layout & taking user configured sorting into account
body:
For the detailed discussion please see #1193, see attached the screenshots for both sortings from my local tests. Works fine switching the sorting in app and then launching the uploader screen via another app.

This branch is based on `master`

Beware of certain "details":
- The buttons are still white since the primary action coloring is part of the `material_buttons` branch
- The list is styled according to @jancborchardt's latests wishes (background white, devider #eee), as it is done for all other lists on the `material_buttons` branch
- The add folder action is shown on the action bar which will be hidden in the future, as seen on the `material_fab` branch since with the introduction of the fab the general guideline has been to hide non-primary actions in the actionbar in the overflow menu
- since the date calculation/visualization is now used in two places I refactored the code accordingly (within this PR)

PR is ready to review, so pinging @tobiasKaminsky @LukeOwncloud @masensio @davivel @jancborchardt for review and integration within the beta branch :)

@jancborchardt Little detail: The title is a re-use of the choose-text which I changed for english but will be "wrong"/old before the branch is merged into master and transifex translations for the other languages come in. Just letting you know :)

![device-2015-11-09-182033](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1315170/11041882/63db6588-8714-11e5-8aa0-68ab69721e4f.png)

![device-2015-11-09-182117](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1315170/11041884/678d9660-8714-11e5-86b7-12f0ba4b6f26.png)

---

BUGS / IMPROVEMENTS:
- [X] Name of the app in uploader view https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1277#issuecomment-225547760 [FIXED]
- [X] Kind of view in uploader view https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1277#issuecomment-225553459 [WON`T FIX]
- [X] Divergence between internal and external uploaders https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1277#issuecomment-225573997 [FIXED]

title: External sd - allow users to specify storage path
Remove »Details« action from file menu
body:
The details screen serves no real purpose anymore. It only duplicates the info which is available elsewhere:
- name
- size
- date
- file type (it even wrongly states SVG files are of type JPEG)
- ability to favorite

So I would say we should get rid of that screen and remove the action in the long-press file menu. This also serves as reducing the actions in the file menu, see https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1144

cc @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger @davivel @masensio @MTRichards

title: Read capabilities for showing share options
Temporarily showing "Nothing in here. Upload something!"
body: When browsing into a new folder it displays "loading...", then for a glimpse "Nothing in here. Upload something!" before it shows the actual content.

title: ownCloud requires new permission READ_PHONE_STATE
body:
I just noticed that the beta version uses a new permission. I tracked the origin of the change down to the master branch: https://github.com/owncloud/android/commit/905b68b4ec886cff35799c0e0604383d9f1d245b#diff-a48d6def78e18cbabab3c95ae3c9fc49R44

I created a comment there but I wanted to create an official issue as well, since I deem this important.

`READ_PHONE_STATE` allows to access a lot of information about the phone, including the IMEI of the phone and details about the SIM card. Is this really necessary? Was it added by accident? I do not find any usage of `TelephonyManager` which would require the permission.

title: Date changed to date of upload (not original)
body:
When uploading a file from Android (only?) the time and date of the file ist changed to time and date of upload. Is it possible to keep the original date and time?

Thanks!

title: Add open url file and share from web browser
body:
this PR provides url file handling.

Url file is short cut of url(like http://...).
When you click url file on owncloud app, app opens web browser.
When you share on web browser with owncloud app, url file is uploaded.
This is very useful to web surfing overlap desktop PCs and smart phones.
In addition, webloc and plain/text are handled.

title: Fix video not previewed #1180
When viewing the downloaded original with the app it seems to show less details then viewing the same picture with another  app
body:
I was really trying to make sure it is not an illusion, but I can confirm it now. When I view the original in OC app it has fewer details (and also allows less zooming in) then QuickPic on the very same picture.

It there any technical reason for this behaviour? I was using the app on my tablet with android 4.1.1.

Please, let me know if I can provide other information that would be useful to You.

title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Suggestion: Make the list / grid view a simple toggle
body:
I was very happy when You introduced the possibility of using the grid view for all folders as I have many forlders with both documents and pictures or scans. Sometimes I do switch between the views as both have its advantages.

When I was using the beta now, I found out that it is a little schizofrenic when EACH folder remembers the last viewing method.

Several times I switched to grid view to look for some picture quickly, and I went through several subdirectories. Later I was viewing some of the diretories in list view.

After some time I ended up with directories (seemingly) randomly switching between grid and list views as I was  going through them. It was kind of.. odd behaviour.

I think it would be better to have the grid/list as a mode switch like in other file managers. (When You use Nautilus or anything else, Your view also doesn’t switch from icon to list view as You go through the directory tree). 

Do You agree with me or do You have a different reason to have the view remembered for each folder?

title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Deleting a local copy when viewing in fullscreen throws me back to directory listing
body:
When I preview the photos in fullscreen and I decide to download the original, the preview gets replaced by the original when the download is finished. That is nice.

When I view an original in fullscreen and then decide to delete it, I think, I should be presented with the large preview and stay in fullscreen mode. Do You agree with me?

title: Beta: 2015-11-05 Menu entry "Upload images taken with camera" is repeated in the config
body: Is there any difference between the two?

title: Beta: add some kind of indication of which build I am using.
body:
I thought that I could use the "View Changelog" menu entry to check which version am I using, but I just noticed that it opens: https://raw.githubcontent.com/owncloud/android/beta/CHANGELOG.mg , which I believe is the changelog for the whole branch.

I almost reported an issue using old build (I installed newer build on the phone yesterday, but not on the tablet, and I used the tablet today)

Adding some kind of indication to identify the build in the app would be nice. Especially for filtering dumb mistakes like the one I almost made.. :sweat:

title: So i have a security issue to discuss - should i post it here?
body: Do you guys have an e-mail i can send it too or should i post here?

title: Owncloud Android doesnt like Android 6 Marshmallow
body:
Hey all,
  Took delivery of a Android 6 enabled phone yesterday and put the Owncloud app on it. It does not like it one bit to be honest, frequent black screen / crash and upload is not working.

I did notice that at no time was i asked for permissions management, this is new in Android 6 in that permissions are supposed to be requested as an when they are needed rather than at install time via marketplace and i'm wondering if this is to blame (access to storage etc).

Anyone else using Android 6 ATM who can confirm?
